channel.title: Wellspring Financial
channel.description: Guiding you to a brighter financial future.

item.title: The effect of psychology on investors
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: You should base financial decisions on logic and facts. But psychology can have a much larger effect than you think, and it can lead to you making decisions that aren’t right for you. Read on to find out more about what behavioural finance is and how it could affect you. “Behavioural finance” was first coined […]

item.title: Spring Budget 2024: Winners and Losers
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: At 12.30pm today, Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt announced the UK Spring Budget, as well as the economic and fiscal forecast by the Office of Budget Responsibility. These legislative announcements are game-changers for Britain’s economy, and Hunt’s announcements included a number of sweeping changes that could potentially affect the personal finances of everyone living […]

item.title: End of the tax year checklist
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: As we approach the end of the tax year, it’s a good time to start thinking about how to make the most of the tax reliefs and allowances you’re entitled to, before they are lost. We’ve put together a checklist to ensure you’re aware of all the ways to make sure you don’t miss out. […]

item.title: Everything you need to know about the 2023 Autumn Statement
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: On 22 November 2023, chancellor Jeremy Hunt delivered the Autumn Statement against a backdrop of a cost of living crisis and a looming general election. It’s been a challenging year with inflation dominating headlines. While inflation has fallen, it’s still higher than the Bank of England’s 2% target at 4.6% in the 12 months to […]

item.title: Market downturns can be scary
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: If you’re worried about their impact on your wealth, find out about 3 crucial reasons for staying invested when times are tough… It’s been a difficult year for investors so far. Inflation and political uncertainty have led to market volatility. Market volatility can be scary, especially if the value of your investments drops, but it’s […]

item.title: Is Drawdown right for you? Two important questions to consider
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: If you have a defined contribution pension, you can access your retirement savings in a variety of ways. One of those options is drawdown – a flexible approach for dipping into your savings when you need to. Read on to learn more about it. 01 How much income are you likely to need throughout your […]

item.title: Is now a good time to remortgage as the Bank of England base rate stays the same?
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: Whilst the Bank of England base rate remains the same, interest rates are still the highest they have been in 15 years. So if you are one of the thousands coming to the end of your fixed rate deal over the next few months it’s very likely you’ll see your payments increase as a result […]

item.title: Healthy benefits included for you and your family?
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: Now those are some little things that can make a big difference. Protection policies aren’t just there for when things go wrong. Many protection insurers include access to a range of health and wellbeing support services – and you don’t need to claim to be able to use them. These services can make everyday life […]

item.title: Income protection – one little change you can make to protect your family’s financial future
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: As a parent, providing for your children is a top priority – from making sure they have food on the table, to ensuring they have the extras they need in life. Putting income protection in place means you’ll always be able to support your children with a regular income if the unthinkable should happen and […]

item.title: The value of advice
item.dc:creator: Rachael Khan
item.description: Financial planners use their experience and expertise to help people build their wealth and reach their long-term financial goals.
